medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed development from early infancy, characterized by ataxia, dysmetria, poor sitting balance, strabismus, and severe vision impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early infancy, with developmental delays noted at 30 months. The patient experienced febrile seizures leading to multiple hospital admissions. As she aged, she exhibited ataxia, dysmetria, poor sitting balance, strabismus, and myopia. At 9 years of age, she was diagnosed with atrophy of the bilateral optic nerves. By 19 years old, she has a severe vision impairment limiting her ability to discern light.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of global developmental delay (GDD) from early infancy, febrile seizures, and atrophy of the bilateral optic nerves at age 9. No anticonvulsants were taken.
